event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a PCIe switch chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a PCIe switch chip.

Nothing is deconfigured.

The non-fatal uncorrectable error trap may cause the domain to panic.


   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

         Internal I/O consists of  SAS Controller, Gigabit Ethernet, Disks, DVD,
         and PCI-Express slots 0, 1, 2, and 3.

         The platform becomes unbootable.


   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:

         PCI-X slot and all internal I/O are deconfigured after the platform is power cycled
         or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
         
         Internal I/O consists of SAS Controller, Gigabit Ethernet, Disks, DVD, and Tape.



   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:

         PCI-X slot and all internal I/O are deconfigured after the platform is power cycled
         or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
         
         Internal I/O consists of SAS Controller, Gigabit Ethernet, Disks, DVD, and Tape.

            IOU#0: Internal I/O includes the DVD drive, the DAT drive, HDD#0 and HDD#1.
            IOU#1: Internal I/O includes HDD#2 and HDD#3.



   External IO Expansion Unit (IOX):


         All PCI-Express slots or PCI-X slots on one boat of an External IO Expansion Unit
         are deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots
         or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.

         The deconfiguration is not persistent across platform power cycles
         or across Dynamic Reconfiguration operations.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:11:54 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: c9868603-04e9-4f31-922d-7d78d46a17f2
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8002-5C for detailed information

   
   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8002-5C, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:11:54 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: c9868603-04e9-4f31-922d-7d78d46a17f2
   DESC: A non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a PCIe switch chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8002-5C for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: All internal I/O behind the PCIe switch chip is deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip
   is located on an IOU) or all the PCI-Express slots or PCI-X slots in an I/O Boat are
   deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip is located on an I/O Boat). The deconfiguration
   will take place after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a
   Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   IMPACT: The non-fatal uncorrectable error trap may cause the domain to panic.
   All internal I/O behind the PCIe switch chip is deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip
   is located on an IOU) or all the PCI-Express slots or PCI-X slots in an I/O Boat are
   deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip is located on an I/O Boat). The deconfiguration
   will take place after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a
   Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u c9868603-04e9-4f31-922d-7d78d46a17f2
         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:11:54.8500 c9868603-04e9-4f31-922d-7d78d46a17f2 SCF-8002-5C
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.io.pciex.switch.se

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0/pci_sw=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0/pci_sw=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B55X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/IOU#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The non-fatal uncorrectable error trap may cause the domain to panic. All internal I/O behind the PCIe switch chip is deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip is located on an IOU) or all the PCI-Express slots or PCI-X slots in an I/O Boat are deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip is located on an I/O Boat). The deconfiguration will take place after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: All internal I/O behind the PCIe switch chip is deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip is located on an IOU) or all the PCI-Express slots or PCI-X slots in an I/O Boat are deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip is located on an I/O Boat). The deconfiguration will take place after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a PCIe switch chip.
